businessProfile.name: Evel Pie
businessProfile.address: 508 Fremont St, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 508 Fremont St, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA

reviews.text:
Such a bad ass hole in the wall gem in the heart of Downtown Las Vegas -Adjacent to the arts district. Love the Evel Knievel theme throughout the dining area and the artsy feel inside with all the slap stickers flooding every wall and blank space.
They have a cool bar, small indoor dining area and a small outdoor patio area.
Great customer service and good drinks. But the food is what brings the entire experience together.  The wings are delicious, meaty, and done well. Love the garlic knots with marinaraüëåüèª and the Caesar salad was good too.
I look forward to coming back and trying their pizza next üëçüèª

Walked in with seven friends and had a great reception. Quick service premade pizzas are delicious and hot. You can custom order pizzas and they do take about 20 minutes to 40 minutes. Depends on how busy they are but it‚Äôs well worth it. The gluten-free option is absolutely amazing. One of my friends is gluten-free one of the best pizzas he‚Äôs ever eaten!  The traditional buffalo wings are non-breaded and great sauce. Step off the strip and have an affordable meal with all of the excellent service and awesome ambience!

We had the chance to try Evil Pie a few months ago while near the Strip, and overall, it was a great experience! Our group ordered a mix of vegan, vegetarian, and meat pizzas‚Äîsomething for everyone.

The standout for me was the vegan jalape√±o cilantro ranch‚Äîseriously, I could drink that stuff. So good! The vegan pepperoni pizza was a solid option, not the best I‚Äôve had, but still tasty and appreciated. I‚Äôm always happy to see vegan options on the menu.

My husband loved the cheese pizza, and the rest of our group gave a big thumbs-up to the regular pepperoni. The wait wasn‚Äôt bad considering how busy they were, but just a heads-up‚Äîit gets really loud inside. It was a bit overstimulating for our daughter, so if you‚Äôre visiting with kids, you might prefer taking it to go.

Overall, we give Evil Pie a solid 4/5. Fun vibe, good pizza, and worth checking out when in Vegas!

If you‚Äôre in Las Vegas and craving an unforgettable slice of pizza, Evel Pie is a must-visit. This funky pizza joint/bar has a super chill vibe, great music, and a cool, down-to-earth staff that makes the whole experience feel laid-back and fun.

I ordered a slice of the chicken and ranch pizza and another one (wish I could remember what it was‚Äîprobably too busy enjoying it!), and let me tell you, these slices are HUGE. Like, one slice could easily take up a whole small pizza box. At about $6.25 a slice, you‚Äôre definitely getting your money‚Äôs worth‚Äîand then some.

The pizza itself? Insanely delicious. Crispy on the edges, cheesy in the middle, and full of bold, creative flavors. Honestly, it might just be the best slice I‚Äôve had in a very long time‚Äîhands down better than any slice I‚Äôve had before.

They call your name over the microphone when your order‚Äôs ready, which just adds to the fun and casual vibe. Whether you‚Äôre just grabbing a quick bite or hanging out for a drink, Evel Pie delivers on taste, size, and good energy. Highly recommend! Don‚Äôt forget this place is on Fremont Street as well.

Oh man, what a find!
So happy that we had heard of this place before going to Vegas. The place is awesome!
Music is cool, atmosphere is cool, the pies are unbelievable!
The staff are so lovely and friendly. They do a slice of pizza and a beer for 8 bucks! It's getting harder and harder to find good deals in Vegas these days but this is a great one!
I definitely recommend this place.

editorial_summary.overview: Pizza joint with a rock 'n' roll vibe & Evel Knievel memorabilia offering slices, whole pies & beer.

recentReviews.text:
Such a bad ass hole in the wall gem in the heart of Downtown Las Vegas -Adjacent to the arts district. Love the Evel Knievel theme throughout the dining area and the artsy feel inside with all the slap stickers flooding every wall and blank space.
They have a cool bar, small indoor dining area and a small outdoor patio area.
Great customer service and good drinks. But the food is what brings the entire experience together.  The wings are delicious, meaty, and done well. Love the garlic knots with marinaraüëåüèª and the Caesar salad was good too.
I look forward to coming back and trying their pizza next üëçüèª

recentReviews.author: Aisha Pleasant
recentReviews.text:
If you‚Äôre in Las Vegas and craving an unforgettable slice of pizza, Evel Pie is a must-visit. This funky pizza joint/bar has a super chill vibe, great music, and a cool, down-to-earth staff that makes the whole experience feel laid-back and fun.

I ordered a slice of the chicken and ranch pizza and another one (wish I could remember what it was‚Äîprobably too busy enjoying it!), and let me tell you, these slices are HUGE. Like, one slice could easily take up a whole small pizza box. At about $6.25 a slice, you‚Äôre definitely getting your money‚Äôs worth‚Äîand then some.

The pizza itself? Insanely delicious. Crispy on the edges, cheesy in the middle, and full of bold, creative flavors. Honestly, it might just be the best slice I‚Äôve had in a very long time‚Äîhands down better than any slice I‚Äôve had before.

They call your name over the microphone when your order‚Äôs ready, which just adds to the fun and casual vibe. Whether you‚Äôre just grabbing a quick bite or hanging out for a drink, Evel Pie delivers on taste, size, and good energy. Highly recommend! Don‚Äôt forget this place is on Fremont Street as well.

recentReviews.author: Jim Morris
recentReviews.text: Walked in with seven friends and had a great reception. Quick service premade pizzas are delicious and hot. You can custom order pizzas and they do take about 20 minutes to 40 minutes. Depends on how busy they are but it‚Äôs well worth it. The gluten-free option is absolutely amazing. One of my friends is gluten-free one of the best pizzas he‚Äôs ever eaten!  The traditional buffalo wings are non-breaded and great sauce. Step off the strip and have an affordable meal with all of the excellent service and awesome ambience!

recentReviews.author: Ashley Weyer
recentReviews.text:
We had the chance to try Evil Pie a few months ago while near the Strip, and overall, it was a great experience! Our group ordered a mix of vegan, vegetarian, and meat pizzas‚Äîsomething for everyone.

The standout for me was the vegan jalape√±o cilantro ranch‚Äîseriously, I could drink that stuff. So good! The vegan pepperoni pizza was a solid option, not the best I‚Äôve had, but still tasty and appreciated. I‚Äôm always happy to see vegan options on the menu.

My husband loved the cheese pizza, and the rest of our group gave a big thumbs-up to the regular pepperoni. The wait wasn‚Äôt bad considering how busy they were, but just a heads-up‚Äîit gets really loud inside. It was a bit overstimulating for our daughter, so if you‚Äôre visiting with kids, you might prefer taking it to go.

Overall, we give Evil Pie a solid 4/5. Fun vibe, good pizza, and worth checking out when in Vegas!

recentReviews.author: Wayne .M Bailey
recentReviews.text:
Oh man, what a find!
So happy that we had heard of this place before going to Vegas. The place is awesome!
Music is cool, atmosphere is cool, the pies are unbelievable!
The staff are so lovely and friendly. They do a slice of pizza and a beer for 8 bucks! It's getting harder and harder to find good deals in Vegas these days but this is a great one!
I definitely recommend this place.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.8/5 rating across 5 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the unique Evel Knievel theme and artsy ambiance, which creates a fun and memorable dining experience. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The diverse menu, including vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free, and traditional options, ensures there's something for everyone, making it a standout choice for groups with varied dietary preferences. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The pizza is praised for its bold, creative flavors and generous portion sizes, offering great value for money. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Loud atmosphere overstimulating for children - social media marketing can improve this area
Vegan options not being the best - review management can address this concern
Competition/discovery issues - SEO services can solve this visibility issue
